title: House Appropriations Chairwoman Nita Lowey to Retire at End of Term
text:
WASHINGTON—Rep. Nita Lowey, the first woman to lead the powerful House Appropriations Committee, won’t seek re-election in 2020, the New York Democrat said Thursday, opening up a primary race that is set to draw a crowd of Democrats, including possibly Chelsea Clinton.

Mrs. Lowey, 82 years old, who represents suburbs north of New York, took the gavel of the House Appropriations Committee in January as House Democrats battled Republicans during the longest government shutdown in U.S. history earlier this year. She will lead...
description: Rep. Nita Lowey (D., N.Y.), the first woman to lead the powerful House Appropriations Committee, won’t seek re-election in 2020, opening up a primary race that is set to draw a crowd of Democrats, including possibly Chelsea Clinton.
